lines.text: They told me, Francis Hinsley, they told me you were hung. With red protruding eyeballs and black protruding tongue.
Rayon chafes, you know. Personally, I find it quite abrasive.

[In thick southern drawl]
Ah shore do feel bad about yore uncle. He's the one that learned me good English.
There's got to be a way to get those stiffs off my property.
Aimee, wait. Now... My dear girl, don't you realize? It's only been money that's been holding me back.
An American would despise himself for living off his wife.
Yes, but you see, I'm English, and we have none of these prejudices in the older and more developed civilizations.
Death has become a middle class business. There's no future in it.
Is that some kind of Beatles haircut?
Listen, I've got to make a little trip over to Beverly Hills... to see a man about a dog.
